original: Oṃ bhadraṃ karṇebhiḥ śṛṇuyāma devāḥ bhadraṃ paśyemākṣabhir yajatrāḥ /
analyzed: om bhadram karṇebhiḥ śṛṇuyāma devāḥ bhadram paśyema akṣabhiḥ yajatrāḥ
translated: Om. May the gods hear what is auspicious with their ears. May the worshipful ones see what is auspicious with their eyes.

original: sthirair aṅgais tuṣṭuvāṃsas tanūbhir vyaśema devahitaṃ yadāyuḥ /
analyzed: sthiraiḥ aṅgaiḥ tuṣṭuvāṃsaḥ tanūbhiḥ vi aśema deva hitam yadā āyuḥ
translated: May we, with firm limbs and bodies, enjoy the life that is beneficial to the gods, while we praise them.

original: svasti na indro vṛddhaśravāḥ svasti naḥ pūṣā viśvavedāḥ /
analyzed: svasti naḥ indraḥ vṛddha śravāḥ svasti naḥ pūṣā viśva vedāḥ
translated: May Indra of great fame be auspicious to us. May the all-knowing Pushan be auspicious to us.

original: svasti nas tārkṣyo 'riṣṭanemiḥ svasti no bṛhaspatir dadhātu /
analyzed: svasti naḥ tārkṣyaḥ riṣṭa nemiḥ svasti naḥ bṛhaspatiḥ dadhātu
translated: May Tarkshya with uninjured wheels be auspicious to us. May Brihaspati grant us auspiciousness.

original: Oṃ śāntiḥ śāntiḥ śāntiḥ / oṃ
analyzed: om śāntiḥ śāntiḥ śāntiḥ om
translated: Om. Peace! Peace! Peace!

original: athāśvalāyano bhagavantaṃ parameṣṭhinam upasametyovāca /
analyzed: atha āśvalāyanaḥ bhagavantam parameṣṭhinam upasametya uvāca
translated: Then Ashvalayana approached the revered Parameshthin and said:

original: adhīhi bhagavan brahmavidyāṃ variṣṭhāṃ sadā sadbhiḥ sevyamānāṃ nigūḍhām /
analyzed: adhīhi bhagavan brahma vidyām variṣṭhām sadā sadbhiḥ sevyamānām nigūḍhām
translated: Teach me, revered one, the supreme knowledge of Brahman, always served by the virtuous, and hidden.

original: yathācirāt yayācirāt sarvapāpaṃ vyapohya parātparaṃ puruṣaṃ yāti vidvān ////
analyzed: yathā acirāt yayā acirāt sarva pāpam vyapohya parātparam puruṣam yāti vidvān
translated: By which, quickly, the learned one, having removed all sin, goes to the Supreme Being, the highest of the high.

original: tasmai sa hovāca pitāmahaś ca śraddhābhaktidhyānayogād avaihi /
analyzed: tasmai sa ha uvāca pitāmahaḥ ca śraddhā bhakti dhyāna yogāt avaihi
translated: To him, the grandfather said: Know it through devotion, faith, and meditation.

original: na karmaṇā na prajayā dhanena tyāgenaike amṛtatvam ānaśuḥ ////
analyzed: na karmaṇā na prajayā dhanena tyāgena eke amṛta tvam ānaśuḥ
translated: Not by action, not by offspring, not by wealth, but by renunciation alone have some attained immortality.

original: pareṇa nākaṃ nihitaṃ guhāyāṃ vibhrājate yad yatayo viśanti /
analyzed: pareṇa nākam nihitam guhāyām vibhrājate yat yatayaḥ viśanti
translated: The highest heaven is placed in the cave, which shines and which the ascetics enter.

original: vedāntavijñānasuniścitārthāḥ saṃnyāsayogād yatayaḥ śuddhasattvāḥ ////
analyzed: vedānta vijñāna su niścita arthāḥ saṃnyāsa yogāt yatayaḥ śuddha sattvāḥ
translated: Those ascetics of pure sattva, who have ascertained the truth of the knowledge of Vedanta, through the yoga of renunciation,

original: te brahmalokeṣu parāntakāle parāmṛtāḥ parāmṛtāt parimucyanti sarve /
analyzed: te brahma lokeṣu para anta kāle para amṛtāḥ para amṛtāt parimucyanti sarve
translated: they all, having attained immortality in the worlds of Brahman at the end of the kalpa, are released from immortality.

original: viviktadeśe ca sukhāsanasthaḥ śuciḥ samagrīvaśiraḥśarīraḥ ////
analyzed: vivikta deśe ca sukha āsana sthaḥ śuciḥ sama grīva śiraḥ śarīraḥ
translated: Seated in a secluded place in a comfortable posture, pure, with neck, head and body straight,

original: antyāśramasthaḥ sakalendriyāṇi nirudhya bhaktyā svaguruṃ praṇamya /
analyzed: antya āśrama sthaḥ sakala indriyāṇi nirudhya bhaktyā sva gurum praṇamya
translated: Dwelling in the final stage of life, restraining all the senses, bowing to the spiritual teacher with devotion,

original: hṛtpuṇḍarīkaṃ virajaṃ viśuddhaṃ vicintya madhye viṣadam viśadaṃ viśokam ////
analyzed: hṛd puṇḍarīkam virajam viśuddham vicintya madhye viṣadam viśadam viśokam
translated: Contemplating in the middle of the stainless, pure lotus of the heart, the clear, pure, sorrowless poison,

original: acintyam avyaktam anantarūpaṃ śivaṃ praśāntam amṛtaṃ brahmayonim /🔽tam ādimadhyāntavihīnam ekaṃ vibhuṃ cidānandam arūpam adbhutam ////
analyzed: acintyam avyaktam ananta rūpam śivam praśāntam amṛtam brahma yonim  tam ādi madhya anta vihīnam ekam vibhum cit ānandam arūpam adbhutam
translated: The inconceivable, unmanifest, infinite-formed, auspicious, tranquil, immortal, source of Brahman,🔽That one without beginning, middle or end, the all-pervading, consciousness, bliss, formless, wonderful,

original: umāsahāyaṃ parameśvaraṃ prabhuṃ trilocanaṃ nīlakaṇṭhaṃ praśāntam /
analyzed: umāsahāyam parameśvaram prabhum trilocanam nīlakaṇṭham praśāntam
translated: The supreme lord, the three-eyed, blue-throated, tranquil one, accompanied by Uma,

original: dhyātvā munirgacchati bhūtayoniṃ samastasākṣiṃ tamasaḥ parastāt ////
analyzed: dhyātvā muniḥ gacchati bhūtayonim samasta sākṣim tamasaḥ parastāt
translated: Meditating on him, the sage goes to the source of beings, the witness of all, beyond darkness.

original: sa brahmā sa śivaḥ sendraḥ so 'kṣaraḥ paramaḥ svarāṭ /
analyzed: sa brahmā sa śivaḥ sa indraḥ saḥ u kṣaraḥ paramaḥ svarāj
translated: He is Brahma, he is Shiva, he is Indra, he is the imperishable, the supreme, the great king.

original: sa eva viṣṇuḥ sa prāṇaḥ sa kālo 'gniḥ sa candramāḥ ////
analyzed: saḥ eva viṣṇuḥ sa prāṇaḥ sa kālaḥ gniḥ sa candramāḥ
translated: He is Vishnu, he is Prana, he is Kala, he is Agni, he is Chandra.

original: sa eva sarvaṃ yad bhūtaṃ yac ca bhavyaṃ sanātanam /
analyzed: saḥ eva sarvam yat bhūtam yat ca bhavyam sanātanam
translated: He is all that exists, all that will be, and all that is eternal.

original: jñātvā taṃ mṛtyum atyeti nānyaḥ panthā vimuktaye ////
analyzed: jñātvā tam mṛtyum atyeti na anyaḥ panthāḥ vimuktaye
translated: Knowing him, one transcends death. There is no other path to liberation.

original: sarvabhūtastham ātmānaṃ sarvabhūtāni cātmani /
analyzed: sarva bhūta stham ātmānam sarva bhūtāni ca ātmani
translated: Seeing the Self in all beings and all beings in the Self,

original: saṃpaśyan brahma paramaṃ yāti nānyena hetunā ////
analyzed: saṃpaśyan brahma paramam yāti na anyena hetunā
translated: one attains the supreme Brahman, not by any other means.

original: ātmānam araṇiṃ kṛtvā praṇavaṃ cottarāraṇim /
analyzed: ātmānam araṇim kṛtvā praṇavam ca uttarāraṇim
translated: Making the Self the lower friction stick, and the Pranava the upper friction stick,

original: jñānanirmathanābhyāsāt pāpaṃ pāśaṃ dahati paṇḍitaḥ ////
analyzed: jñāna nirmathana abhyāsāt pāpam pāśam dahati paṇḍitaḥ
translated: the wise one burns the noose of sin by the practice of friction with the knowledge.

original: sa eva māyāparimohitātmā śarīram āsthāya karoti sarvam /
analyzed: saḥ eva māyā parimohita ātmā śarīram āsthāya karoti sarvam
translated: He alone, his Self deluded by Maya, takes up a body and does everything.

original: striyannapānādivicitrabhogaiḥ sa eva jāgrat paritṛptim eti ////
analyzed: striya anna pāna ādi vicitra bhogaiḥ saḥ eva jāgrat paritṛptim eti
translated: He alone, with various enjoyments like women, drinks, etc., goes to complete satisfaction while awake.

original: svapna svapne sa jīvaḥ sukhaduḥkhabhoktā svamāyayā kalpitajīvaloke /
analyzed: svapna svapne sa jīvaḥ sukha duḥkha bhoktā sva māyayā kalpita jīva loke
translated: In a dream, that living being experiences happiness and sorrow in the world of living beings created by his own Maya.

original: suṣuptikāle sakale vilīne tamo 'bhibhūtaḥ sukharūpam eti ////
analyzed: suṣupti kāle sakale vilīne sukha rūpam eti
translated: At the time of deep sleep, when everything is dissolved, overwhelmed by darkness, he attains the form of happiness.

original: punaśca janmāntarakarmayogāt sa eva jīvaḥ svapiti prabuddhaḥ /
analyzed: punar ca janma antara karma yogāt saḥ eva jīvaḥ svapiti prabuddhaḥ
translated: And again, due to the connection with actions in another birth, that same living being sleeps and awakens.

original: puratraye krīḍati yaśca jīvas tatas tu jātaṃ sakalaṃ vicitram ////🔽dhāramānandam akhaṇḍabodhaṃ yasmiṃl layaṃ yāti puratrayaṃ ca ////
analyzed: puratraye krīḍati yaḥ ca jīvaḥ tatas tu jātam sakalam vicitram  dhāram ānandam akhaṇḍa bodham yasmin layam yāti puratrayam ca
translated: And the living soul plays in the three cities, from which all this wonderful universe has originated.🔽In which the three cities dissolve, the bliss of consciousness, the unbroken knowledge,

original: etasmāj jāyate prāṇo manaḥ sarvendriyāṇi ca /
analyzed: etasmāt jāyate prāṇaḥ manaḥ sarva indriyāṇi ca
translated: From this is born the vital breath, the mind, and all the senses.

original: khaṃ vāyur jyotir āpaḥ pṛthivī viśvasya dhāriṇī ////
analyzed: kham vāyuḥ jyotiḥ āpaḥ pṛthivī viśvasya dhāriṇī
translated: Space, air, fire, water, and earth, the supporter of the universe.

original: yat paraṃ brahma sarvātmā viśvasyāyatanaṃ mahat /
analyzed: yat param brahma sarva ātmā viśvasya āyatanam mahat
translated: That which is the supreme Brahman, the soul of all, the great abode of the universe,

original: sūkṣmāt sūkṣmataraṃ nityaṃ tat tvam eva tvam eva tat ////
analyzed: sūkṣmāt sūkṣmataram nityam tat tvam eva tvam eva tat
translated: Subtler than the subtle, eternal, that is You alone, and You alone are that.

original: jāgratsvapnasuṣuptyādiprapañcaṃ yat prakāśate /
analyzed: jāgrat svapna suṣupti ādi prapañcam yat prakāśate
translated: The universe that manifests in the states of waking, dreaming, and deep sleep,

original: tad brahmāham iti jñātvā sarvabandhaiḥ pramucyate ////
analyzed: tat brahma aham iti jñātvā sarva bandhaiḥ pramucyate
translated: Knowing that as Brahman and I, one is liberated from all bondage.

original: triṣu dhāmasu yad bhogyaṃ bhoktā bhogaś ca yad bhavet /
analyzed: triṣu dhāmasu yat bhogyam bhoktā bhogaḥ ca yat bhavet
translated: Whatever is to be enjoyed in the three abodes, the enjoyer, and the enjoyment,

original: tebhyo vilakṣaṇaḥ sākṣī cinmātro 'haṃ sadā śivaḥ ////
analyzed: tebhyaḥ vilakṣaṇaḥ sākṣī cit mātraḥ ham sadā śivaḥ
translated: I am the witness, distinct from them, consciousness alone, always auspicious.

original: mayy eva sakalaṃ jātaṃ mayi sarvaṃ pratiṣṭhitam /
analyzed: mayi eva sakalam jātam mayi sarvam pratiṣṭhitam
translated: Everything is born from me alone, everything is established in me,

original: mayi sarvaṃl layaṃ yāti tad brahmādvayam asmy aham ////
analyzed: mayi sarvan layam yāti tat brahma advayam asmi aham
translated: Everything dissolves in me, that Brahman is non-dual, I am that.

original: iti prathamaḥ khaṇḍaḥ //
analyzed: iti prathamaḥ khaṇḍaḥ
translated: Thus ends the first section.

original: aṇor aṇiyān aham eva tadvan mahān ahaṃ viśvam ahaṃ vicitram /
analyzed: aṇoḥ aṇiyān aham eva tadvat mahān aham viśvam aham vicitram
translated: I am smaller than the smallest and greater than the greatest. I am wonderful and diverse in the universe.

original: purātano 'haṃ puruṣo 'ham īśo hiraṇmayo 'haṃ śivarūpam asmi ////
analyzed: purātanaḥ ham puruṣaḥ ham īśaḥ hiraṇmayaḥ ham śiva rūpam asmi
translated: I am ancient, I am the supreme being, I am the lord, I am golden, I am of the form of Śiva.

original: apāṇipādo 'ham acintyaśaktiḥ paśyāmy acakṣuḥ sa śṛṇomy akarṇaḥ /
analyzed: a pāṇi pādaḥ ham a cintya śaktiḥ paśyāmi a cakṣuḥ sa śṛṇomi a karṇaḥ
translated: I am without hands and feet, I have inconceivable power, I see without eyes, I hear without ears.

original: ahaṃ vijānāmi viviktarūpo na cāsti vettā mama cit sadāham ////
analyzed: aham vijānāmi vivikta rūpaḥ na ca asti vettā mama cit sadā aham
translated: I know, having a distinct form, there is no knower of me, I am always consciousness.

original: vedair anekair aham eva vedyo vedāntakṛd vedavid eva cāham /
analyzed: vedaiḥ anekaiḥ aham eva vedyaḥ vedānta kṛt veda vid eva ca aham
translated: I am to be known by many Vedas, I am the author of Vedānta, and I am the knower of the Vedas.

original: na puṇyapāpe mama nāsti nāśo na janma dehendriyabuddhir asti ////
analyzed: na puṇya pāpe mama nā asti nāśaḥ na janma deha indriya buddhiḥ asti
translated: I have no merit or sin, I have no destruction, I have no birth, no body, senses or intellect.

original: na bhūmir āpo na ca vahnir asti na cānilo me 'sti na cāmbaraṃ ca /
analyzed: na bhūmiḥ āpaḥ na ca vahniḥ asti na ca anilaḥ me sti na ca ambaram ca
translated: I have no earth, no water, no fire, no air, and no space.

original: evaṃ viditvā paramātmarūpaṃ guhāśayaṃ niṣkalam advitīyam ////
analyzed: evam viditvā paramātma rūpam guhā āśayam niṣkalam advitīyam
translated: Knowing thus the supreme self, the abode in the cave, the partless, the one without a second,

original: samastasākṣiṃ sadasadvihīnaṃ prayāti śuddhaṃ paramātmarūpam ////
analyzed: samasta sākṣim sat asat vihīnam prayāti śuddham paramātma rūpam
translated: The witness of all, devoid of existence and non-existence, one goes to the pure supreme self.

original: yaḥ śatarūdrīyam adhīte so 'gnipūto bhavati sa vāyupūto bhavati /
analyzed: yaḥ śatarūdrīyam adhīte saḥ agni pūtaḥ bhavati sa vāyu pūtaḥ bhavati
translated: One who studies the Śatarudriya becomes purified by fire, becomes purified by air,

original: sa ātmapūto bhavati sa surāpānāt pūto bhavati sa brahmahatyātpūto bhavati sa suvarṇasteyāt
analyzed: saḥ ātma pūtaḥ bhavati sa surā pānāt pūtaḥ bhavati sa brahmahatyāt pūtaḥ bhavati sa suvarṇa steyāt
translated: He becomes purified of his soul, he becomes purified of drinking liquor, he becomes purified of killing a Brahmin, he becomes purified of stealing gold,

original: pūto bhavati sa kṛtyākṛtyāt pūto bhavati tasmād avimuktam āśrito bhavaty āśramī sarvadā sakṛd vā japet /
analyzed: pūtaḥ bhavati sa kṛtyā akṛtyāt pūtaḥ bhavati tasmāt avimuktam āśritaḥ bhavati āśramī sarvadā sakṛt vā japet
translated: he becomes purified of what should and should not be done. Therefore, one should always resort to Avimukta, the stage of life, or recite it once.

original: anena jñānam āpnoti saṃsārārṇavanāśanam /
analyzed: anena jñānam āpnoti saṃsāra arṇava nāśanam
translated: By this, one attains knowledge that destroys the ocean of worldly existence.

original: tasmād evaṃ viditvainaṃ kaivalyaṃ padam phalam aśnute /
analyzed: tasmāt evam viditvā enam kaivalyam padam phalam aśnute
translated: Therefore, knowing this, one enjoys the fruit of the state of liberation.

original: kaivalyaṃ padam phalam aśnute ////
analyzed: kaivalyam padam phalam aśnute
translated: One enjoys the fruit of the state of liberation.

original: ity atharvavede kaivalyopaniṣat samāptā //
analyzed: iti atharvavede kaivalya upaniṣad samāptā
translated: Thus ends the Kaivalya Upanishad in the Atharva Veda.

original: oṃ tat sat
analyzed: om tat sat
translated: Om Tat Sat
